page.title: 05ORDNANCE DEPOT, THATCHAM.
page.content: We went to visit the Ordnance Depot in Station Rd. (map reference 578664). The administrative officer, Mrs. Holden took us on a tour of the depot. We discovered that the depot was established in 1940 by the British Government as a General stores and during the war was handed over to the U.S.A.army.In 1946 the depot was handed back to the R.A.O.C. at which time there were 800 Americans,600 civilians and 2,000 prisoners of war. We saw army helmets, sleeping bags, canoes, climbing equipment, skis and a model army tank, in fact everything needed to furnish a soldier's home or for use in the army's adventure training. We also saw a policeman and one of the dogs that help to guard the depot. 271 people work there, approximately half of them women.
